channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Game Development Club Presents Analog GameJam!
item.description: We’re shaking things up! Join the RPI Game Development Club in Sage 2411 (VAST) for an out-of-the-box Game Jam, and make an Analog Game in 48 hours! Overnight breaks begin at 10:00 PM on both Friday and Saturday nights, and doors re-opening at 8:00 AM each morning. This event is open to RPI students of all majors and all levels of experience! Please contact club president, Aiden Crossfield (crossa2@rpi.edu) for more information and to sign up.

item.description: All graduate students are invited to submit abstracts for poster, podium, and/or artwork for the 10th Annual Graduate Research Symposium, scheduled for Friday, April 11. Deadline to submit abstracts is Friday, March 14.

item.title: MVP Health Care to host Virtual Info Session | Wed., March 19, at 1PM!
item.description: Join MVP Health Care for an exclusive, RPI-only info session focused on Summer 2025 internships! The event will take place virtually on Monday, March 19th at 1PM. Learn about the exciting Summer 2025 Internship Opportunities at MVP Health Care! Topics discussed include: Why Apply to MVP Internships, Departments That Are Hiring, Opportunity for Q&A. Log into Handshake to register!

item.title: Fire Evacuation Drills to be Conducted during March and April
item.description: Fire evacuation drills will be conducted in all campus buildings during March and April. These unannounced drills are required by New York State Fire Code and provide an opportunity for building occupants to practice evacuation procedures.

item.title: DotCIO Posts Reminder Regarding Compliance with Campus Email Policy
item.description: Members of DotCIO’s IT Security team wish to remind all members of the Rensselaer community that Institute policy states that email accounts obtained through third parties may not be used in conducting the business of the Institute, and that ensuring compliance with the Rensselaer email policy is crucial.
item.author: Community

item.title: EMPAC Tour with Amadeus Julian Regucera, music curator
item.description: Saturday, March 15, 2025 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - EMPAC building tours take visitors behind the scenes to experience the center’s infrastructure as few do. In this curator’s tour, Amadeus Julian Regucera discusses the acoustic and visual potential of each venue for the making of complex artworks, with stories from recent productions. Open to the public at no cost. Meet in the Main Lobby.

item.title: RPI Orchestra and ESYO, Side by Side: 2025 Spring Concert to be Held April 5
item.description: Celebrate the collaboration between the Rensselaer Orchestra and the Empire State Youth Orchestra as they perform side-by-side April 5th at 7pm in EMPAC Concert Hall. This spring program includes the breathtaking ‘Elysium’ by Samy Moussa, the famous ‘Symphonie Fantastique’ by Hector Berlioz, and the evocative Oboe Concerto by Thomas L. Read, featuring 2024 Rensselaer Concerto Competition winner Gianna Scire, ’25 as soloist.
item.author: Community

item.title: Computer Science Colloquia: Edward Lee, Pragmatic Type and Effect Systems | March 19
item.description: Wednesday, March 19, 2025 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - Edward Lee is a PhD candidate at the University of Waterloo, advised by Ondřej Lhoták. He conducts research in programming language theory and compilers, currently on pragmatic type and type-and-effect systems for tracking side effects such as mutation and exceptions. His work has been generously supported and recognized by scholarships from the Province of Ontario and the Natural Sciences and Engineering Research Council of Canada.

item.title: Virtual Consultations with CDPHP Nurse or Member Services
item.description:
As part of our wellness initiatives, the Division of Human Resources is excited to continue this quarterly series where you can meet virtually with a CDPHP Nurse or a Member Services representative on Monday, March 17, 2025 from 1pm - 4pm. Each 15 minute session will be facilitated by CDPHP and pre-registration is required. Sign up for your free, virtual session today!
